place.name: ST ISHMAELS
place.gazetteerText: ISHMAEL'S (ST.), a village and a parish in Haverfordwest district, Pembroke. The village stands on Milford haven, 5½ miles W of Milford r. station; and has a post office under Milford. The parish comprises 3, 007 acres of land and 1, 160 of water. Real property, £3, 847. Pop., 469. Houses, 92. The property is divided among a few. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of St. Davids. Value, £90. Patron, the Lord Chancellor. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
